answers.answer: I ahve been diagnosed with pcos and that was after I had both of my children. I passed my glucose test both times and never had a problem. They also say that even if you don't have GD you may still not process sugar properly and the baby can be quite large. I had an aversion to sugar most of my pregnancies so my babies were both 7 pounds. I would advise to just eat as healthy as you can and anything that happens is out of your control. Good Luck I hope you pass.

question: Hey everyone.  I went to see my ob/gyn yesterday for results and check up as last week I went for my big ultrasound.  Well everything is perfect considering the rocky start I had in the first 9weeks in hospital.  Anyways I am 21 weeks today and my doc will see me in 4weeks and then organise for my glucose testing only he made me aware that becos I am labelled with having PCOS I am more prone to having diabetes and more importantly gestational diabetes so he is heading me straight for the 3hr test.  This is my first furtherest pregnancy so I am not concerned mainly cos I have never been in this position before but was wondering if anyone with pcos who had to have the 3hr test passed?  I am just so happy that i am pregnant and with what I went thru to get here I am determined nothing is going to dampin my positive mind.  Was great tho I thought that my ob/gyn isnt mucking me around....gotta say he is wonderful and I am blessed with such a caring doctor cos I have heard some duzzy horror stories!  goodluck everyone!Oh just for facts, we are exactly 1week ahead of dates but because we know exactly when, where and what time ovulation occured the doc isnt changing dates, still June1.....And I didnt find out the sex.
title: Link between gestational diabetes and PCOS!
